faqs.question: I heard many Coral Springs homes have aluminum wiring—is that true?
faqs.answer: Yes, many homes built in Coral Springs during the 1970s aluminum wiring boom—particularly in Ramblewood, Shadow Wood, and older sections of the city—contain aluminum branch wiring. Aluminum wiring isn't inherently dangerous, but it requires proper connections and maintenance. The real issue is when aluminum connects to outlets and switches designed for copper only. We provide aluminum wiring assessments and, when needed, install COPALUM or AlumiConn connectors that make these connections safe, often without complete rewiring.

faqs.question: We're adding a pool to our Coral Springs backyard—what electrical work is needed?
faqs.answer: Pool installations require significant electrical work: a dedicated 220V circuit for the pump (sometimes 50+ amps for variable-speed pumps), pool light circuit, GFCI protection for all pool-area receptacles, proper bonding of metal components, and often a sub-panel near the equipment pad. Coral Springs requires permits for pool electrical, and inspectors here are thorough. We handle everything from planning through final inspection—it's one of our most common Coral Springs projects.

faqs.question: Can you install landscape lighting in my Coral Springs HOA community?
faqs.answer: Absolutely—we work frequently in Wyndham Lakes, Eagle Ridge, Whispering Woods, and other Coral Springs HOA communities. Most landscape lighting doesn't require HOA approval, but we advise confirming before installation. We install low-voltage LED landscape systems that highlight your home's best features, improve security, and use minimal electricity. For permanent uplighting or pathway lights, we run proper wiring with waterproof connections designed for Florida's weather.

faqs.question: Our Coral Springs home's breakers keep tripping when we run the AC and oven together—why?
faqs.answer: This classic sign of an overloaded electrical system is extremely common in 1970s-80s Coral Springs homes. These homes were built with 100-amp or 150-amp panels that simply can't handle modern AC systems, electric ovens, multiple refrigerators, and all the electronics we use today. The solution is typically a panel upgrade to 200 amps, giving your home the capacity to run everything simultaneously without constantly tripping breakers.

faqs.question: Do you work on the commercial buildings along Sample Road and University Drive?
faqs.answer: Yes, we provide commercial electrical services throughout Coral Springs, including the retail and office corridors along Sample Road, University Drive, and The Walk at Coral Springs. Services include lighting retrofits, electrical maintenance agreements, tenant buildout wiring, sign circuits, and 24/7 emergency response for commercial power issues.

faqs.question: How fast can you get to Coral Springs for an electrical emergency?
faqs.answer: We maintain electricians in northwest Broward County specifically to serve Coral Springs, Parkland, and Coconut Creek quickly.  For after-hours emergencies—especially those involving safety hazards like sparking, burning smells, or complete power loss—we allocate resources and can often arrive within an hour.
